headline: Pennsylvania Democrats Ditch Biden Event As His Poll Numbers Tank
author: Michael Ginsberg
sentences: In Pennsylvania, however, a poll conducted in late October by Franklin & Marshall College found that 32% of registered Pennsylvania voters thought Biden was doing a “good” or “excellent” job, a twelve-point drop from his June support.

Biden will visit Mill 19, a tech hub developed by Carnegie Mellon University on the grounds of a former steel mill, to promote the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act and discuss manufacturing and supply chains.

Please take note of the travel and parking restrictions that will be in place.https://t.co/J14l216A3G pic.twitter.com/kOmuW9kLWl
— Pittsburgh Public Safety (@PghPublicSafety) January 27, 2022
However, Democratic Lt. Gov.
Georgia gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams also cited a scheduling conflict when explaining why she would not appear at Biden’s Jan. 11 voting rights speech at the Atlanta University Center.
A Morning Call/Muhlenberg College poll conducted in December found that a key source of Biden’s declining approval rating was Pennsylvanians’ frustration with the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.
During that speech, Biden called for Senate Democrats to eliminate the filibuster to pass a pair of election nationalization bills and compared his political opponents to segregationists.
Two leading Democrats running for statewide office in Pennsylvania will not appear alongside President Joe Biden at a Friday tour of a Pittsburgh-area tech development hub.
Fetterman is currently leading the Democratic Senate primary field, several polls have shown, while Shapiro will likely be the Democratic nominee for governor.

(RELATED: These Are The Most Important Senate Races In 2022)
Fetterman and Shapiro are not the first candidates in tight races to avoid the low-polling Biden.
Forty percent of Pennsylvania adults approved of Biden’s handling of COVID-19 at the time that poll was taken, down from 55% in the spring.
John Fetterman and state Attorney General Josh Shapiro will not attend due to scheduling conflicts, the Associated Press reported.
Scientists and engineers at Mill 19, located in Hazelwood, Pennsylvania, work primarily on robotics and artificial intelligence.
Joining him will be Democratic Rep. Conor Lamb, who is running to replace retiring Republican Sen. Pat Toomey.
Nationally, Biden is consistently polling below 45% support, with one poll showing him as low as 36%.
He first announced the infrastructure bill in the western Pennsylvania hub in a March 2021 speech.
Friday’s visit will be Biden’s second to the Pittsburgh area as president.
Public Safety is making preparations for the President’s stay in the city.
President Joe Biden plans to visit to Pittsburgh on Friday, January 28.
